bibl.note: In P.G.M., xiii, 473 ff., an account of creation, the spelling βερειθεν βεριο looks as if it could be a slightly garbled version of the opening words of the Bible, that is, of the first words of the account of God's creation, b(e)re' shith bara ("in the beginning He [God] created").
bibl.seg: JACOBSON Howard, Papyri Graecae Magicae XIII 477.

In P.G.M., xiii, 473 ff., an account of creation, the spelling βερειθεν βεριο looks as if it could be a slightly garbled version of the opening words of the Bible, that is, of the first words of the account of God's creation, b(e)re' shith bara ("in the beginning He [God] created").
